article.headline: UMass 85, Elon 67
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. -- Sophomore transfer Chaz Williams scored 18 points and handed out eight assists as Massachusetts defeated Elon 85-67 Friday night in a rare appearance at the Curry Hicks Cage. The game was the second in 18 years for the Minutemen at their former campus home, which they gave up to move into the Mullins Center in 1993. Williams, playing his first game for Massachusetts after transferring from Hofstra, also grabbed six rebounds and had three steals for the Minutemen. Terrell Vinson added 17 points and 11 rebounds for the Minutemen and Sampson Carter also scored 17. After Elon took its largest lead of the game, 45-39 with 19:46 remaining, Massachusetts outscored the Phoenix 21-4 over the next 5:09 to lead 60-49 with 14:37 left. Carter scored eight of his points during the run, which included 11 Massachusetts points off turnovers. Lucas Troutman scored 15 points and Drew Spradlin 14 for Elon.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
